Name: Kashi Vishwanath Temple
Description: The Kashi Vishwanath Temple is one of the most revered Hindu temples in India, dedicated to Lord Shiva. Situated on the western bank of the Ganges River in Varanasi, it is one of the twelve Jyotirlingas, sacred shrines where Shiva is worshipped in the form of a fiery column of light. The current structure was constructed in 1780 by Maharani Ahilyabai Holkar of Indore.

Name: Kanak Bhawan Temple
Description: Kanak Bhawan, also known as 'Sone-ka-Ghar' (House of Gold), is a revered temple dedicated to Lord Rama and Goddess Sita. Legend holds that Queen Kaikeyi gifted this palace to Sita after her marriage to Rama. The temple has been renovated multiple times, with the current structure built in 1891 by Queen Vrish Bhanu of Orchha. It houses three pairs of idols of Rama and Sita, adorned with gold crowns, reflecting the deep devotion and rich heritage of the region.

Name: Janaki Mandir
Description: Janaki Mandir is a revered Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Sita, located in Janakpur, Nepal. Built in 1910 by Queen Vrisha Bhanu of Tikamgarh, it showcases a blend of Mughal and Koiri architecture. The temple is significant for its association with the Sita-Ram marriage and is a major pilgrimage site.

Name: Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga
Location: Ujjain (Note: Ujjain is in Madhya Pradesh but often linked culturally)
Description: Mahakaleshwar Temple is one of the twelve Jyotirlingas dedicated to Lord Shiva. Located in Ujjain, it is renowned for its Bhasma Aarti and holds immense religious significance. The temple's lingam is believed to be Swayambhu (self-manifested).

Name: Ambedkar Park
Description: Ambedkar Memorial Park is a public park and memorial dedicated to Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, located in Gomti Nagar, Lucknow. The park features grand architecture, including statues of prominent social reformers and 62 elephant statues symbolizing strength.

Name: Munshi Ghat Temple
Description: Munshi Ghat is one of the prominent ghats on the banks of the Ganges in Varanasi. Known for its architectural beauty, it is a popular spot for rituals, meditation, and observing the vibrant culture of the city.

Name: Shri Ram Janmabhoomi
Description: Shri Ram Janmabhoomi is believed to be the birthplace of Lord Rama. The site is of immense religious significance and has been the center of historical and cultural importance in India.

Name: Bidhan Temple
Description: Bidhan Temple is a lesser-known temple in Mathura, dedicated to Lord Krishna. It is a place of worship and holds cultural significance for the local devotees.

Name: Golden Temple (Harmandir Sahib)
Description: The Golden Temple, also known as Sri Harmandir Sahib, is the holiest shrine in Sikhism. This stunning gold-plated temple sits in the middle of a sacred pool called the Amrit Sarovar. It's renowned for its spiritual significance, architectural beauty, and the world's largest free community kitchen (langar) that serves meals to thousands daily regardless of religion or background.

Name: Durgiana Temple
Description: Resembling the Golden Temple, this Hindu temple is dedicated to Goddess Durga. It features silver doors and is surrounded by a sacred lake.

Name: Kali Mata Mandir
Description: A revered temple dedicated to Goddess Kali, located in the heart of Patiala. It's known for its vibrant celebrations during Navratri.

Name: Shiv Mandir
Description: An ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, drawing devotees especially during Mahashivratri. A peaceful spiritual site in Gurdaspur.

Name: Shri Devi Talab Mandir
Description: One of the oldest temples in Punjab, this shrine to Goddess Durga sits beside a sacred pond and features a replica of the Amarnath Cave.

Name: Kali Devi Temple
Description: A spiritual destination dedicated to Goddess Kali, known for regional religious significance and annual rituals.

Name: Mukteshwar Mahadev Temple
Description: Located near Shahpur Kandi, this cave temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is said to have been visited by the Pandavas.

Name: Sheetla Mata Mandir
Description: A temple devoted to Sheetla Mata, goddess of health. The temple is especially visited by women and children for blessings.

Name: Hanuman Mandir
Description: A popular temple devoted to Lord Hanuman. It sees heavy footfall on Tuesdays and during Hanuman Jayanti.

Name: Amarnath Temple
Description: A sacred Hindu shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva, renowned for the naturally occurring ice Shivlingam.

Name: Vaishno Devi Temple
Description: One of the most revered Hindu pilgrimage sites dedicated to Goddess Vaishno Devi.

Name: Shankaracharya Temple
Description: An ancient temple perched atop Shankaracharya Hill, offering panoramic views of Srinagar and Dal Lake.

Name: Raghunath Temple
Description: A complex of seven Hindu shrines dedicated to Lord Rama, known for its rich collection of scriptures.

Name: Bahu Fort & Kali Temple
Description: An ancient fort housing the Bawe Wali Mata Temple, dedicated to Goddess Kali.

Name: Peer Kho Cave Temple
Description: An ancient cave temple dedicated to Lord Shiva also known as the Jamvant Gufa.

Name: Martand Sun Temple
Description: Ruins of a 8th-century temple dedicated to the Sun God, showcasing impressive ancient architecture.

Name: Kheer Bhawani Temple
Description: A temple dedicated to Goddess Ragnya Devi, revered by Kashmiri Pandits.

Name: Sharika Devi Temple
Description: Located on Hari Parbat Hill, this temple is dedicated to Goddess Sharika, an incarnation of Durga.

Name: Mahakali Temple
Description: Also known as Bawe Wali Mata Temple, it's a revered shrine dedicated to Goddess Mahakali.

Name: Shiv Khori Cave Temple
Description: A natural cave shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva, featuring a self-manifested lingam.

Name: Sudh Mahadev Temple
Description: An ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, believed to be over 3,000 years old.

Name: Nau Devi Temple
Description: A cave temple housing nine naturally formed pindis, representing nine forms of Goddess Durga.

Name: Lotus Temple
Description: The Lotus Temple, notable for its flowerlike shape, is a Bahá'í House of Worship in Kalkaji, New Delhi. Completed in December 1986, it serves as a place of worship open to all, regardless of religion or any other qualification.

Name: Birla Mandir (Laxminarayan Temple)
Description: Also known as Laxminarayan Temple, this Hindu temple is dedicated to Laxmi (the goddess of prosperity) and Narayana (The preserver). Built by industrialist J.K. Birla in 1939, it was inaugurated by Mahatma Gandhi on the condition that people of all castes would be allowed to enter.

Name: Akshardham Temple
Description: Swaminarayan Akshardham in New Delhi is a spiritual-cultural campus dedicated to devotion, learning, and harmony. The complex showcases traditional Hindu and Indian culture, spirituality, and architecture.

Name: Kalkaji Mandir
Description: Kalka Mandir, also known as Kalkaji Mandir, is a famous Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess Kali. Located near Nehru Place in Delhi, it is one of the oldest and most revered temples in the city.

Name: Chhatarpur Temple
Description: Chhatarpur Temple, officially known as Shri Aadya Katyayani Shakti Peetham, is dedicated to Goddess Katyayani. Spread over 70 acres, it is one of the largest temple complexes in India, constructed entirely from marble.

Name: Hanuman Mandir
Description: Hanuman Temple in Connaught Place is an ancient Hindu temple believed to be one of the five temples from the Mahabharata era in Delhi. It is dedicated to Lord Hanuman and is known for its unique architecture and spiritual significance.

Name: ISCKON Temple
Description: ISKCON Temple in Delhi is dedicated to Lord Krishna and Radha. It serves as a center for spiritual learning and devotion, offering daily prayers, kirtans, and spiritual discourses.

Name: Jhandewalan Mandir
Description: Jhandewalan Mandir is a revered temple dedicated to Goddess Durga. Located in the Jhandewalan area of Delhi, it is a significant pilgrimage site, especially during the Navratri festival.

Name: Nehru Temple
Description: There is no widely recognized temple known as Nehru Temple in Chanakyapuri  Delhi. However Nehru Park a large park named after India's first Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru is located in this area and is known for its lush greenery and cultural events.

Name: Shri Digambar Jain Lal Mandir
Description: Shri Digambar Jain Lal Mandir is the oldest and best-known Jain temple in Delhi, located directly across from the Red Fort in the historical Chandni Chowk area. It is renowned for its avian veterinary hospital, the Jain Birds Hospital, situated behind the main temple.

Name: Jwalamukhi Temple
Description: A revered Shakti Peeth where natural gas flames emerge from fissures in the rock, worshipped as the manifestation of the goddess.

Name: Baijnath Temple
Description: An ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, renowned for its Nagara-style architecture and spiritual significance.

Name: Hidimba Devi Temple
Description: A unique temple dedicated to Hidimba Devi, surrounded by cedar forests, known for its wooden architecture.

Name: Naina Devi Temple
Description: One of the 51 Shakti Peeths, perched atop a hill offering panoramic views, dedicated to Goddess Naina Devi.

Name: Chintpurni Temple
Description: A significant Shakti Peeth where devotees seek blessings to alleviate worries, dedicated to Goddess Chintpurni.

Name: Bhimakali Temple
Description: A majestic temple complex showcasing a blend of Hindu and Buddhist architecture, dedicated to Goddess Bhimakali.

Name: Chamunda Devi Temple
Description: An important shrine dedicated to Goddess Chamunda, situated amidst scenic surroundings.

Name: Shoolini Mata Temple
Description: A revered temple dedicated to Goddess Shoolini, after whom the town of Solan is named.

Name: Tara Devi Temple
Description: Perched on a hilltop, this temple offers panoramic views and is dedicated to Goddess Tara Devi.

Name: Jakhoo Temple
Description: Situated on Jakhoo Hill, this temple is dedicated to Lord Hanuman and is known for its towering statue.

Name: Manimahesh Temple
Description: A sacred site near Manimahesh Lake, believed to be the abode of Lord Shiva, attracting pilgrims during the annual yatra.

Name: Laxmi Narayan Temple
Description: A group of six temples built in the 10th century, showcasing exquisite stone carvings, dedicated to Lord Vishnu and other deities.

Name: Maa Hateshwari Temple
Description: An ancient temple complex dedicated to Goddess Hateshwari, known for its unique architecture and serene environment.

Name: Konark Sun Temple
Description: A 13th-century architectural marvel, the Sun Temple is designed as a colossal chariot with intricately carved stone wheels, pillars, and walls, dedicated to the Sun God.

Name: Rajarani Temple
Description: Known for its exquisite carvings and unique architecture the temple is often referred to as the love temple due to its erotic sculptures.

Name: Lingaraj Temple
Description: One of the oldest temples in Bhubaneswar, dedicated to Lord Shiva, showcasing the Kalinga style of architecture.

Name: Mukteswar Temple
Description: A 10th-century temple renowned for its detailed carvings and the magnificent torana (arched gateway).

Name: Jagannath Temple
Description: One of the Char Dham pilgrimage sites, dedicated to Lord Jagannath (a form of Lord Vishnu).

Name: Ananta Vasudeva Temple
Description: A rare Vishnu temple in Bhubaneswar, showcasing Vaishnavite architecture.

Name: Biraja Temple
Description: An ancient Shakti Peetha dedicated to Goddess Durga, known locally as Viraja.

Name: Chausathi Jogini Temple
Description: A unique circular temple dedicated to 64 Yoginis, showcasing tantric traditions.

Name: Subarnameru Temple
Description: A revered Shiva temple located on the banks of the Tel River, known for its golden idol.

Name: Baladevjew Temple
Description: Dedicated to Lord Baladevjew (Balarama), the temple is known for its grand Rath Yatra.

Name: Kalighat Kali Temple
Description: One of the 51 Shakti Peethas, where the toes of Goddess Sati are believed to have fallen. It's a revered site for devotees of Goddess Kali.

Name: Dakshineswar Kali Temple
Description: Built in 1855 by Rani Rashmoni, this temple is dedicated to Goddess Bhavatarini (Kali) and is associated with the mystic Ramakrishna Paramahamsa.

Name: Tarapith Temple
Description: A significant Tantric pilgrimage site dedicated to Goddess Tara, known for its association with the saint Bamakhepa.

Name: Belur Math
Description: Headquarters of the Ramakrishna Math and Mission, founded by Swami Vivekananda. The temple architecture symbolizes unity of all religions.

Name: Hanseswari Temple
Description: A unique 13-spired temple dedicated to Goddess Hanseswari, showcasing a blend of traditional Indian and European architectural styles.

Name: Birla Mandir
Description: A modern marble temple built by the Birla family, dedicated to Lord Vishnu and Goddess Lakshmi, known for its intricate carvings.

Name: Adyapeath Temple
Description: Established in 1921, this temple is dedicated to Goddess Adya Shakti and is part of the Dakshineswar Ramkrishna Sangha.

Name: Jagannath Temple
Description: A temple dedicated to Lord Jagannath, mirroring the architectural style of the Puri Jagannath Temple, and managed by the Sri Jagannath Seva Samiti.

Name: Bholanath Mandir
Description: A local temple in Shyambazar dedicated to Lord Shiva, serving as a spiritual center for the local community.

Name: Mukutmanipur Temple
Description: Located near the Mukutmanipur Dam, this temple is a serene spot offering picturesque views and spiritual solace.

Name: Kamakhya Temple
Description: Situated atop Nilachal Hill, the Kamakhya Temple is one of the oldest and most revered centers of Tantric practices, dedicated to the goddess Kamakhya. It is considered one of the 51 Shakti Peethas and holds immense religious significance.

Name: Umananda Temple
Description: Located on Peacock Island in the middle of the Brahmaputra River, Umananda Temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva. Built in 1694 by the Ahom King Gadadhar Singha, it is renowned for its serene environment and unique location.

Name: Basistha Temple
Description: Situated in the south-east corner of Guwahati city, Basistha Temple is a Shiva mandir with historical significance dating back to the Vedic age. The temple stands on the bank of mountain streams originating from the Meghalaya hills.

Name: Sankardev Kalakshetra
Description: A cultural institution named after the medieval poet-playwright and reformer Srimanta Sankardev, it serves as a center for preserving and showcasing the cultural heritage of Assam and the Northeast. The complex includes a museum, library, and open-air theater.

Name: Hayagriva Madhava Temple
Description: Situated on the Monikut hill near Hajo, this temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu in his Hayagriva (horse-headed) form. Built by King Raghudeva Narayan in 1583, it is a revered site for both Hindus and Buddhists.

Name: Navagraha Temple
Description: Located on Chitrasal Hill, the Navagraha Temple is dedicated to the nine celestial bodies (Navagrahas) of Hindu astronomy. Each planet is represented by a Shivalinga, and the temple is an important center for astrological and religious practices.

Name: Dwarkadhish Temple
Description: Also known as Jagat Mandir, this temple is dedicated to Lord Krishna. Believed to have been established over 2,500 years ago by Krishna’s grandson Vajranabh, it is a significant pilgrimage site and one of the Char Dham destinations. The five-storied structure, supported by 72 pillars, showcases intricate Chalukya-style architecture.

Name: Akshardham Temple
Description: A majestic temple complex dedicated to Bhagwan Swaminarayan, Akshardham is constructed from 6,000 tonnes of pink sandstone without using steel. The temple stands 108 feet tall and is surrounded by 23 acres of manicured gardens. It serves as a spiritual and cultural campus promoting devotion, education, and unification.

Name: Somnath Temple
Description: Somnath Temple is the first among the twelve Jyotirlinga shrines of Lord Shiva. Located on the western coast of Gujarat, it has been a significant pilgrimage site for centuries. The temple has been reconstructed several times due to historical invasions and stands today as a symbol of resilience and faith.

Name: Ambaji Temple
Description: Ambaji Temple is a revered Shakti Peeth dedicated to Goddess Amba. Located near the Gujarat-Rajasthan border, the temple is built from white marble and features a golden cone atop its structure. It is surrounded by an open square called Chachar Chowk, where ceremonial rituals are performed.

Name: Patan Jain Temple
Description: This historic temple, also known as Jinalaya Vanraj Vihar, is one of the most significant Jain temples in Patan. Spanning 180 feet in length and 90 feet in width, it boasts intricate carvings, domes, and sacred art, reflecting the rich Jain heritage of the region.

Name: Rani ki Vav
Description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Rani ki Vav is an intricately constructed stepwell built in the 11th century by Queen Udayamati in memory of her husband, King Bhimdev I. Located on the banks of the Saraswati River, it showcases the pinnacle of Maru-Gurjara architectural style with elaborate sculptures and carvings.

Name: Mandir of Shamlaji
Description: Situated on the banks of the Meshvo River, Shamlaji Temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu and is a significant pilgrimage center. Built of white sandstone and bricks, the temple features profuse carvings depicting episodes from the Ramayana and Mahabharata, along with beautiful domed ceilings and a traditional spire.

Name: Nal Sarovar Temple
Description: Located about 64 km from Ahmedabad, Nal Sarovar is a vast wetland and bird sanctuary spread over 120.82 sq km. It is a haven for over 250 species of migratory and resident birds, including pelicans, flamingos, and cranes, making it a paradise for bird watchers and nature enthusiasts.

Name: Shani Shingnapur
Description: Dedicated to Lord Shani (Saturn), this unique temple is renowned for its open-air shrine and the village's tradition of houses without doors, symbolizing the deity's protective presence.

Name: Siddhi Vinayak Temple
Description: Located in Prabhadevi, this temple is one of Mumbai's most revered shrines, dedicated to Lord Ganesha. It's known for its rich history and attracts devotees from all over the country.

Name: Shirdi Sai Baba Temple
Description: This temple complex is the final resting place of Sai Baba, a revered spiritual leader. It draws millions of devotees annually, seeking blessings and spiritual solace.

Name: Trimbakeshwar Shiva Temple
Description: One of the twelve Jyotirlingas, this temple is situated at the source of the Godavari River. It's renowned for its unique architecture and spiritual significance.

Name: Mhalsa Devi Temple
Description: Dedicated to Goddess Mhalsa, an incarnation of Mohini, this temple is a significant spiritual center in the region, known for its serene ambiance and religious importance.

Name: Bhimashankar Temple
Description: Nestled in the Sahyadri hills, this temple is one of the twelve Jyotirlingas. It's also part of a wildlife sanctuary, offering a blend of spiritual and natural experiences.

Name: Ashtavinayak Temples (Multiple Locations)
Description: The Ashtavinayak pilgrimage covers eight ancient temples of Lord Ganesha, each with its own unique legend and significance, spread across Maharashtra.

Name: Dagdusheth Halwai Ganpati
Description: This temple is one of the most famous Ganesha temples in Maharashtra, known for its rich history and the grandeur of its annual Ganeshotsav festival.

Name: Nathdwara Shrinathji Temple
Description: Dedicated to Lord Krishna, this temple is a significant pilgrimage site for Vaishnavites and is renowned for its intricate architecture and spiritual ambiance.

Name: Dilwara Temples
Description: A group of remarkable Jain temples known for their stunning use of marble and intricate carvings, showcasing the architectural brilliance of the 11th to 13th centuries.

Name: Jain Temple
Description: An exquisite marble temple dedicated to Tirthankara Rishabhanatha, featuring 1,444 uniquely carved pillars, exemplifying the pinnacle of Jain architecture.

Name: Somnath Temple
Description: A revered temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, known for its serene environment and spiritual significance in the region.

Name: Birla Mandir
Description: Also known as the Laxmi Narayan Temple, this modern white marble temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu and Goddess Lakshmi, reflecting contemporary Hindu architecture.

Name: Karni Mata Temple
Description: Famous for its population of sacred rats, this temple is dedicated to Karni Mata and is a unique pilgrimage site attracting visitors worldwide.

Name: Ganesh Temple
Description: An ancient temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha, known for its historical significance and the belief that wishes made here are fulfilled.

Name: Bhawani Mata Temple
Description: A sacred temple dedicated to Goddess Bhawani, offering a tranquil environment for devotees seeking blessings.

Name: Shri Eklingji Temple
Description: A revered temple complex dedicated to Lord Shiva, serving as the family deity of the Mewar rulers, known for its architectural grandeur and spiritual significance.

Name: Chaturbhuj Temple
Description: An ancient temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu, notable for its architectural design and spiritual ambiance within the walled city of Jaipur.

Name: Moti Dungri Ganesh Temple
Description: A prominent temple dedicated to Lord Ganesha, situated on a hilltop, known for its unique architecture and religious significance.

Name: Jagat Temple
Description: A historic temple dedicated to Lord Krishna and Meera Bai, showcasing exquisite carvings and a blend of Hindu and Jain architectural styles.

Name: Khatu Shyam Ji Temple
Description: A significant pilgrimage site dedicated to Khatu Shyam Ji, believed to be the manifestation of Barbarika, attracting devotees from across the country.

Name: Sanchi Stupa
Description: The Sanchi Stupa is one of the oldest stone structures in India, originally commissioned by Emperor Ashoka in the 3rd century BCE. This hemispherical dome enshrines relics of the Buddha and is adorned with intricately carved gateways depicting scenes from his life. Recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, it stands as a testament to ancient Indian architecture and Buddhist heritage.

Name: Khajuraho Temples
Description: Built between 950 and 1050 CE during the Chandela dynasty, the Khajuraho Group of Monuments comprises Hindu and Jain temples renowned for their Nagara-style architecture and intricate sculptures, including those with erotic themes. These temples reflect a fusion of spirituality and artistic expression, earning them UNESCO World Heritage status.

Name: Bhojeshwar Temple
Description: Located near Bhopal, the Bhojeshwar Temple is an unfinished 11th-century temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, commissioned by Raja Bhoj. It houses one of the tallest lingams in India, standing at 7.5 feet. Despite its incomplete state, the temple showcases the architectural prowess of the Paramara dynasty.

Name: Omkareshwar Temple
Description: Situated on the Mandhata island in the Narmada River, Omkareshwar Temple is one of the 12 revered Jyotirlinga shrines of Lord Shiva. The island's shape resembles the sacred 'Om' symbol, enhancing its spiritual significance. The temple attracts devotees year-round, especially during religious festivals.

Name: Mahakaleshwar Jyotirlinga
Description: Located in Ujjain, Mahakaleshwar Temple is another of the 12 Jyotirlingas dedicated to Lord Shiva. Unique for its south-facing idol, the temple is considered highly auspicious. It is renowned for the Bhasma Aarti, a ritual performed with sacred ash, attracting thousands of devotees daily.

Name: Kaliadeh Palace
Description: Situated on the banks of the Shipra River, Kaliadeh Palace is a historic site known for its architectural beauty and scenic surroundings. Once a retreat for the Scindia royalty, the palace complex includes a Sun Temple and is a popular spot for tourists seeking tranquility and history.

Name: Tirupati Temple (Tirumala Venkateshwara)
Description: The Tirumala Venkateswara Temple, situated in the hill town of Tirumala, is one of the most revered and wealthiest temples in India. Dedicated to Lord Venkateswara, an incarnation of Vishnu, the temple attracts millions of devotees annually. It is renowned for its Dravidian architecture and the elaborate rituals performed daily.

Name: Kanaka Durga Temple
Description: Perched atop the Indrakeeladri Hill, the Kanaka Durga Temple is dedicated to Goddess Kanaka Durga. It is a significant Shakti Peetha and is especially vibrant during the Navaratri festival. The temple's Dravidian architecture and panoramic views of the Krishna River make it a notable pilgrimage site.

Name: Ahobilam Temple
Description: Located in the Nallamala Hills, Ahobilam is renowned for its temples dedicated to Lord Narasimha, the lion-headed avatar of Vishnu. The site comprises nine shrines, each representing a different form of Narasimha, making it a significant center for Vaishnavite worship.

Name: Mallikarjuna Temple
Description: The Mallikarjuna Temple in Srisailam is one of the twelve Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva and also a Shakti Peetha, making it a unique confluence of Shaivism and Shaktism. Nestled in the Nallamala forest, the temple's serene environment and architectural grandeur attract pilgrims year-round.

Name: Mantralayam Temple
Description: Situated on the banks of the Tungabhadra River, Mantralayam is the abode of Sri Raghavendra Swamy, a 17th-century saint and proponent of the Dvaita philosophy. The temple complex includes the Brindavana (tomb) of the saint and is a hub for spiritual learning and devotion.

Name: Simhachalam Temple
Description: The Simhachalam Temple is dedicated to Lord Varaha Narasimha, a combined form of Vishnu's avatars Varaha and Narasimha. The deity is covered with sandalwood paste throughout the year, giving it a linga-like appearance, and is revealed only once annually during the Chandanotsavam festival.

Name: Ramamandiram Temple
Description: The Ramanarayanam Temple is a modern spiritual and cultural complex dedicated to Lord Rama. Designed in the shape of a bow and arrow, the temple offers a unique architectural experience and serves as a center for cultural activities and spiritual learning.

Name: Virupaksha Temple
Description: The Virupaksha Temple, located in Hampi, is a 7th-century Shiva temple and one of the oldest functioning temples in India. It features a towering nine-tiered gopuram and intricate carvings, reflecting the grandeur of the Vijayanagara Empire.

Name: Vitthala Temple
Description: The Vittala Temple is renowned for its exceptional architecture, including the iconic Stone Chariot and musical pillars. It stands as a testament to the artistic excellence of the Vijayanagara period.

Name: Pattabhirama Temple
Description: https://hampitourism.co.in/images/places-to-visit/headers/vijaya-vittala-temple-hampi-tourism-entry-fee-timings-holidays-reviews-header.jpg

Name: Chamundeshwari Temple
Description: Situated atop Chamundi Hills, this temple is dedicated to Goddess Chamundeshwari, an incarnation of Durga. It is a significant spiritual center and offers panoramic views of Mysore city.

Name: Banashankari Temple
Description: Located in Bangalore, the Banashankari Temple is dedicated to Goddess Banashankari, a form of Parvati. Established in the early 20th century, it is a revered site for devotees seeking the goddess's blessings.

Name: Melukote Temple
Description: This temple, located in Melukote, is dedicated to Lord Vishnu in the form of Cheluvanarayana Swamy. It is an important center for the Srivaishnava tradition and is known for its annual Vairamudi festival.

Name: Kukke Subramanya Temple
Description: Nestled in the Western Ghats, this temple is dedicated to Lord Subramanya, who is worshipped here as the lord of all serpents. It is a significant pilgrimage site for rituals related to sarpa dosha.

Name: ISCKON Temple
Description: The ISKCON Temple in Bangalore is one of the largest ISKCON temples in the world. Dedicated to Lord Krishna, it is known for its architectural grandeur and spiritual activities.

Name: Padmanabhaswamy Temple
Description: The Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple, located in Thiruvananthapuram, is a revered Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Vishnu. It is renowned for its intricate Dravidian architecture and the deity's unique reclining posture on the serpent Anantha. The temple is also famous for its immense wealth and treasures discovered in its vaults.

Name: Sabarimala Temple
Description: Situated atop the Sabarimala hill in the Periyar Tiger Reserve, this temple is dedicated to Lord Ayyappa. It is one of the largest annual pilgrimage sites globally, attracting millions of devotees, especially during the Mandala season.

Name: Guruvayur Temple
Description: The Guruvayur Temple is dedicated to Lord Guruvayurappan a form of Lord Vishnu. Known as the Dwarka of the South it is one of the most important pilgrimage centers in Kerala renowned for its strict rituals and elephant sanctuary.

Name: Chottanikkara Temple
Description: Located near Kochi, this temple is dedicated to Goddess Bhagavathy, worshipped in three forms: Saraswati in the morning, Lakshmi at noon, and Durga in the evening. It is believed to have healing powers, especially for mental ailments.

Name: Attukal Bhagavathy Temple
Description: Often referred to as the Sabarimala of Women this temple is dedicated to Goddess Bhadrakali. It is famous for the Attukal Pongala festival  which holds the Guinness World Record for the largest gathering of women for a religious activity.

Name: Ranganathaswamy Temple
Description: Located in Srirangam, this temple is dedicated to Lord Ranganatha, a reclining form of Vishnu. It is the largest functioning Hindu temple complex in the world, covering 156 acres. The temple is renowned for its intricate Dravidian architecture and holds immense significance in the Vaishnavism tradition.

Name: Meenakshi Temple
Description: Situated in Madurai, this historic temple is dedicated to Goddess Meenakshi (a form of Parvati) and her consort Sundareswarar (a form of Shiva). The temple complex is known for its towering gopurams adorned with colorful sculptures and is a masterpiece of Dravidian architecture.

Name: Ramanathaswamy Temple
Description: Located on Rameswaram Island, this temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is one of the twelve Jyotirlinga temples. It is famed for its longest corridor among all Hindu temples and holds immense significance in Shaivism.

Name: Shore Temple
Description: This UNESCO World Heritage Site, located in Mahabalipuram, is one of the oldest structural stone temples in South India. Built during the reign of the Pallava dynasty, it stands as a testament to early Dravidian architecture.

Name: Sripuram Golden Temple
Description: Situated in Thirumalaikodi near Vellore, this temple is dedicated to Goddess Lakshmi and is renowned for its gold-coated sanctum. The temple complex is designed in the shape of a star and is surrounded by a spiritual park.

Name: Brihadeshwara Temple
Description: Also known as Peruvudaiyar Kovil, this UNESCO World Heritage Site is located in Thanjavur. Built by Chola emperor Rajaraja I in the 11th century, it is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is a prime example of Dravidian architecture.

Name: Chennakesava Temple
Description: Located in Belur, Karnataka, this temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu and is an exemplary representation of Hoysala architecture. The temple is renowned for its intricate carvings and detailed sculptures.

Name: Thillai Nataraja Temple
Description: Situated in Chidambaram, this temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva in his form as Nataraja, the cosmic dancer. It is one of the few temples where both Shaivite and Vaishnavite deities are enshrined.

Name: Annamalaiyer Temple
Description: Located at the base of Annamalai hills in Thiruvannamalai, this temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is one of the Pancha Bhoota Stalas, representing the element of fire. The temple is known for its massive gopurams and spiritual significance.

Name: Kailashanatha Temple
Description: This ancient temple in Kanchipuram is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is one of the oldest structural temples in South India. Built by the Pallava dynasty in the 8th century, it showcases early Dravidian architecture.

Name: Mahabodhi Temple
Description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site where Gautama Buddha attained enlightenment under the Bodhi tree. It's one of the most sacred pilgrimage spots for Buddhists worldwide.

Name: Mundeshwari Temple
Description: Considered one of the oldest functional Hindu temples, dedicated to Shiva and Shakti, showcasing early Nagara-style architecture.

Name: Vishnupad Temple
Description: A sacred Hindu temple believed to bear the footprint of Lord Vishnu. It’s an important destination for pind daan (ancestor rituals).

Name: Patna Sahib Gurudwara
Description: One of the five Takhts (seats of authority) in Sikhism, it marks the birthplace of Guru Gobind Singh Ji.

Name: Sultanganj Buddha Statue
Description: A 7.5-feet tall bronze Buddha statue from the Gupta period, one of the finest examples of ancient Indian metal art.

Name: Bhoramdeo Temple
Description: Often called the Khajuraho of Chhattisgarh this 11th-century temple is known for its exquisite erotic sculptures and Nagara architecture.

Name: Danteshwari Temple
Description: One of the 52 Shakti Peethas in India, dedicated to Goddess Danteshwari and built by the Chalukyas in the 14th century.

Name: Mahanadi Temple
Description: A temple located near the banks of the Mahanadi River, associated with regional riverine worship and cultural fairs.

Name: Mangeshi Temple
Description: Shri Mangesh Temple located in Priol Ponda Taluka is one of the most prominent temples in Goa dedicated to Lord Shiva. The temple is known for its simple yet elegant architecture and is a significant place of worship for the local Hindu community.

Name: Shanta Durga Temple
Description: Shree Shantadurga Temple situated at the foothill of Kavalem village in Ponda Taluka is dedicated to Goddess Shantadurga who is believed to have mediated between Lord Vishnu and Lord Shiva. The temple is known for its Indo-Portuguese architecture.

Name: Dudhsagar Falls Temple
Description: Dudhsagar Falls located in the Sanguem Taluka is one of the tallest waterfalls in India. The area around the falls is known for its scenic beauty and is a popular tourist destination.

Name: Shri Mahalaxmi Temple
Description: Shri Mahalaxmi Temple located in Bandora is dedicated to Goddess Mahalaxmi the consort of Lord Vishnu. The temple is an important religious site for the Goan Hindu community.

Name: Bhuteshwar Temple
Description: Bhuteshwar Temple in Jind is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is part of the 48 kos parikrama of Kurukshetra. The temple is known for its large water tank called Rani Talab.

Name: Brahma Sarovar Temple
Description: Brahma Sarovar in Kurukshetra is a sacred water tank associated with Lord Brahma. It is believed to be the site where Lord Brahma created the universe.

Name: Sthaneshwar Mahadev Temple
Description: Sthaneshwar Mahadev Temple in Kurukshetra is dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is believed that the Pandavas prayed here before the battle of Mahabharata.

Name: Bhadrakali Temple
Description: Bhadrakali Temple in Kurukshetra is one of the 51 Shakti Peethas and is dedicated to Goddess Bhadrakali. The temple is a significant pilgrimage site.

Name: Kartikeya Temple
Description: Kartikeya Temple in Pehowa is dedicated to Lord Kartikeya the son of Lord Shiva. The temple is known for its ancient architecture and religious significance.

Name: Shri Durga Bhavani Mandir
Description: Shri Durga Bhavani Mandir in Fatehabad is dedicated to Goddess Durga. The temple is a center of devotion and attracts numerous devotees.

Name: Sheetla Mata Mandir
Description: Sheetla Mata Mandir in Gurgaon is dedicated to Goddess Sheetla believed to cure diseases. The temple is a major pilgrimage site especially during Navratri.

Name: Kalka Devi Temple
Description: Kalka Devi Temple in Kalka is dedicated to Goddess Kali. The temple is situated at the foothills of the Himalayas and is a gateway to Himachal Pradesh.

Name: Shri Siddh Baba Balak Nath Temple
Description: Shri Siddh Baba Balak Nath Temple in Kalka is dedicated to Baba Balak Nath a revered saint. The temple is visited by devotees seeking blessings.

Name: Chandi Mandir
Description: Chandi Mandir in Panchkula is dedicated to Goddess Chandi. The temple is located near the Chandigarh-Kalka road and is an important religious site.

Name: Baba Mastnath Temple
Description: Baba Mastnath Temple in Rohtak is dedicated to Baba Mastnath a revered saint. The temple complex also houses the Baba Mastnath University.

Name: Shri Radha Krishan Mandir
Description: Shri Radha Krishan Mandir in Panipat is dedicated to Lord Krishna and Radha. The temple is known for its beautiful architecture and spiritual ambiance.

Name: Shri Hanuman Mandir
Description: Shri Hanuman Mandir in Karnal is dedicated to Lord Hanuman. The temple is a place of worship and attracts devotees from nearby regions.

Name: Baidyanath Temple
Description: Baba Baidyanath Dham in Deoghar Jharkhand is one of the 12 holy Jyotirlingas. Lord Shiva is worshipped here as the healer Baidyanath. Devotees believe a visit offers blessings for well-being and spiritual growth.

Name: Parasnath Temple
Description: Parasnath Hills located in Giridih district of Jharkhand is one of the most important pilgrimage centers for Jains. The hill is named after Parasnath the 23rd Tirthankara. Twenty of Jain Tirthankaras attained salvation on this hill.

Name: Jagannath Temple
Description: Jagannath Temple in Ranchi is a historic temple dedicated to Lord Jagannath. Built in 1691 by King Thakur Ani Nath Shahdeo it resembles the Jagannath Temple in Puri and is a significant pilgrimage site.

Name: Chhinnamasta Temple
Description: Chhinnamasta Temple located in Rajrappa is dedicated to Goddess Chhinnamasta. The temple is known for its Tantric style of architecture and attracts devotees from Jharkhand and neighboring states.

Name: Bhadrakali Temple
Description: Bhadrakali Temple situated in Itkhori is dedicated to Goddess Bhadrakali. The temple is located on the bank of river Mahanad surrounded by hills and forests and is a popular pilgrimage site.

Name: Jonha Falls Temple
Description: Jonha Falls located about 45 kms from Ranchi is also known as Gautamdhara. The area is known for its scenic beauty and houses a temple dedicated to Lord Buddha.

Name: Hanuman Temple
Description: Hanuman Temple in Deoghar is dedicated to Lord Hanuman and is situated near the Baba Baidyanath Dham. It is a significant place of worship for devotees visiting Deoghar.

Name: Sundernath Temple
Description: Sundernath Temple located in Sundernath is dedicated to Lord Shiva. The temple is known for its religious significance and attracts devotees especially during the month of Shravan.

Name: Shri Govindajee Temple
Description: Shree Shree Govindajee Temple is a historic center of the Vaishnavites in Manipur. It has a golden twin domed temple which attracts a large number of devotees.

Name: Sanamahi Temple
Description: The Sanamahi Kiyong Temple at Nongmaijing Hills Imphal East is the abode of Lainingthou Sanamahi the ancient deity of the Meitei. It is a center of the followers of Sanamahism in Manipur.

Name: Kangla Fort Temple
Description: Kangla Fort was the seat of Manipur's power till 1891 and holds a special place in the hearts of the people of Manipur. The old Govindajee temple outer and inner moat and other relics reflect the rich heritage of Manipur.

Name: Langthabal Temple
Description: Langthabal Konung also known as the Old Palace is a historic royal palace located in Manipur. It is an important historical site drawing visitors interested in the history and heritage of Manipur.

Name: Thangjing Temple
Description: Thangjing Temple is an ancient temple dedicated to the god Thangjing the ancient national deity of Keke Moirang. The best time to visit the temple is from May to July during the Lai Haraoba festival.

Name: Ibudhou Pakhangba Laishang Temple
Description: Pakhangba Temple also known as the Pakhangba Laishang is a Meitei temple dedicated to the God Pakhangba of Sanamahism located inside the Kangla Fort in Imphal.

Name: Nartiang Durga Temple
Description: Nartiang Durga Temple located in West Jaintia Hills district is a 600-year-old temple and one of the 51 Shakti Peethas. It is a significant pilgrimage site especially during Durga Puja.

Name: Mawphlang Sacred Grove
Description: Mawphlang Sacred Grove is a preserved forest area in East Khasi Hills known for its rich biodiversity and cultural significance. It is considered sacred by the local Khasi community.

Name: Shillong Cathedral
Description: The Cathedral of Mary Help of Christians located in Shillong is one of the most beautiful churches in Meghalaya. It is known for its stunning architecture and serene ambiance.

Name: U Lum Sohpetbneng
Description: U Lum Sohpetbneng is a sacred peak in Shillong considered the navel of the earth by the Khasi people. It holds religious significance and is a site for annual pilgrimages.

Name: Lalong Monastery
Description: Lalong Monastery located in Shillong is a serene place of worship and meditation. It is known for its peaceful environment and spiritual significance.

Name: Kyrdemkulai
Description: Kyrdemkulai is a picturesque village in East Khasi Hills known for its natural beauty and cultural heritage. It is a popular destination for eco-tourism.

Name: Solomon's Temple
Description: Solomon's Temple in Aizawl Mizoram is a majestic church built by the Holy Church known locally as Kohhran Thianghlim. Founded by Dr. L.B. Sailo in 1984 the temple is a significant religious site and a popular tourist attraction.

Name: Thenzawl Presbyterian Church
Description: Thenzawl Presbyterian Church located in Thenzawl Mizoram is a prominent place of worship for the local Presbyterian community known for its serene environment and architectural beauty.

Name: Chawngtlai Tomb
Description: Chawngtlai Tomb situated in Chawngtlai village Mizoram is a historical site reflecting the rich cultural heritage of the Mizo people and is a point of interest for visitors.

Name: Reiek Tlang Sacred Site
Description: Reiek Tlang is a scenic hill located near Aizawl Mizoram offering panoramic views and is considered a sacred site by the local community. It is also a popular trekking destination.

Name: Kohima Cathedral
Description: The Mary Help of Christians Cathedral in Kohima Nagaland is a prominent Catholic church known for its unique architecture that blends traditional Naga design with modern elements.

Name: Diphupar Rainforest Sacred Site
Description: The Diphupar Rainforest in Dimapur Nagaland is a sacred site revered by the local communities for its biodiversity and cultural significance.

Name: Naga Heritage Village
Description: Naga Heritage Village located in Kisama near Kohima Nagaland showcases the rich cultural heritage of the Naga tribes through traditional huts artifacts and cultural performances.

Name: St. Joseph’s Cathedral
Description: St. Joseph’s Cathedral in Kohima Nagaland is a significant Catholic church serving as the main church of the Diocese of Kohima known for its spiritual and architectural prominence.

Name: Dimapur Jain Temple
Description: Dimapur Jain Temple established in 1947 is a prominent place of worship for the Jain community in Nagaland known for its intricate architecture and spiritual ambiance.

Name: Kirateshwar Mahadev Temple
Description: Kirateshwar Mahadev Temple located in Legship Sikkim is a revered Hindu temple dedicated to Lord Shiva associated with legends from the Mahabharata and is a significant pilgrimage site.

Name: Rumtek Monastery
Description: Rumtek Monastery, also known as the Dharma Chakra Centre, is the largest monastery in Sikkim. Situated 24 km from Gangtok, it serves as the main seat-in-exile of the Karmapa, the head of the Karma Kagyu lineage of Tibetan Buddhism. The monastery is renowned for its vibrant architecture and sacred art.

Name: Bombay Palace
Description: Bombay Palace is a popular Indian restaurant located in Gangtok, Sikkim. Known for its authentic Indian cuisine, it offers a variety of dishes that cater to diverse tastes. The restaurant is a favorite among locals and tourists alike.

Name: Enchey Monastery
Description: Enchey Monastery, established in 1909, is a significant Nyingma monastery located 3 km northeast of Gangtok. It is believed to be built on the site blessed by Lama Drupthob Karpo, a tantric master known for his flying powers. The monastery is an important pilgrimage site and hosts the annual Cham dance festival.

Name: Tashiding Monastery
Description: Tashiding Monastery is a revered Nyingma monastery situated atop a hill between the Rathong and Rangeet rivers. It is considered the most sacred and holiest monastery in Sikkim, often referred to as the 'Heart of Sikkim.' The monastery is known for the annual Bhumchu festival.

Name: Phodong Monastery
Description: Phodong Monastery, located 38 km from Gangtok, is one of the six premier monasteries of Sikkim. Belonging to the Karma Kagyu sect, it was built in the early 18th century and is known for its ancient murals and annual religious dances.

Name: Ralong Monastery
Description: Ralong Monastery, also known as Karma Rabtenling, is the first monastery of the Kagyupa lineage in Sikkim. Built in 1730 by the fourth Chogyal Gyurmed Namgyal, it is located near Ravangla and is renowned for its collection of thangkas and murals.

Name: Tripura Sundari Temple
Description: Tripura Sundari Temple, also known as Matabari, is one of the 51 Shakti Peethas in India. Located in Udaipur, it was built in 1501 by Maharaja Dhanya Manikya and is dedicated to Goddess Tripura Sundari. The temple is a major pilgrimage site, especially during Diwali.

Name: Jagannath Temple
Description: Jagannath Temple, situated within the Ujjayanta Palace grounds in Agartala, is dedicated to Lord Jagannath, Balabhadra, and Subhadra. The temple is known for its vibrant architecture and is a significant religious site in Tripura.

Name: Chaturdasha Temple
Description: Chaturdasha Temple, located in Old Agartala, is dedicated to fourteen deities known as the Chaturdasha Devata. Built in 1760 by King Krishna Manikya, the temple is central to the Kharchi festival celebrated annually.

Name: Mahadev Temple
Description: Mahadev Temple in Agartala is a revered shrine dedicated to Lord Shiva. It attracts devotees throughout the year, especially during the Mahashivratri festival. The temple is known for its serene ambiance and spiritual significance.

Name: Neermahal Temple
Description: Neermahal, meaning 'Water Palace,' is a former royal palace built by King Bir Bikram Kishore Manikya in the middle of Rudrasagar Lake. It showcases a blend of Hindu and Islamic architectural styles and is a popular tourist attraction.

Name: Chitai Golu Devta Temple
Description: Chitai Golu Devta Temple, located 8 km from Almora, is dedicated to Golu Devta, an incarnation of Lord Shiva. The temple is famous for the thousands of bells offered by devotees and is believed to fulfill wishes.

Name: Badrinath Temple
Description: Badrinath Temple, situated in the town of Badrinath, is one of the Char Dham pilgrimage sites. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu, the temple is located along the Alaknanda River and is surrounded by the Nar and Narayana mountain ranges.

Name: Kedarnath Temple
Description: Kedarnath Temple, dedicated to Lord Shiva, is one of the twelve Jyotirlingas in India. Located near the Mandakini River, it is a part of the Char Dham pilgrimage and is accessible via a trek from Gaurikund.

Name: Gangotri Temple
Description: Gangotri Temple, dedicated to Goddess Ganga, is situated at an elevation of 3,100 meters in the Uttarkashi district. It is one of the four sites in the Char Dham pilgrimage circuit and marks the origin of the River Ganges.

Name: Yamunotri Temple
Description: Yamunotri Temple, located in the Uttarkashi district, is dedicated to Goddess Yamuna. It is the first stop in the Char Dham pilgrimage and is situated at an altitude of 3,293 meters.

Name: Har Ki Pauri
Description: Har Ki Pauri is a famous ghat on the banks of the Ganges in Haridwar. It is believed to be the precise spot where the Ganges leaves the mountains and enters the plains. The Ganga Aarti performed here is a major attraction.

Name: Neelkanth Mahadev Temple
Description: Neelkanth Mahadev Temple, located near Rishikesh, is dedicated to Lord Shiva. It is situated at the confluence of the Pankaja and Madhumati rivers and is surrounded by dense forests and mountain ranges.

Name: Naina Devi Temple
Description: Naina Devi Temple, situated on the northern shore of Naini Lake in Nainital, is dedicated to Goddess Naina Devi. It is believed to be one of the 51 Shakti Peeths and is a significant religious site in the region.

Name: Mansa Devi Temple
Description: Mansa Devi Temple, located atop the Bilwa Parvat in Haridwar, is dedicated to Goddess Mansa Devi. The temple is accessible via a ropeway and offers panoramic views of the city and the Ganges River.

Name: Chandi Devi Temple
Description: Chandi Devi Temple, situated atop Neel Parvat in Haridwar, is a revered Hindu shrine dedicated to Goddess Chandi Devi. Built in 1929 by King Suchat Singh, the temple is accessible via a 3 km trek or a ropeway. It is one of the Panch Tirth (Five Pilgrimages) in Haridwar and is considered a Siddh Peetha, where devotees' wishes are believed to be fulfilled.

Name: Bharat Mata Mandir
Description: Bharat Mata Mandir, located in Haridwar, is a unique multi-storied temple dedicated to Mother India. Each floor of the temple is dedicated to different deities, freedom fighters, and leaders, symbolizing unity in diversity. The temple serves as a tribute to Indian nationalism and heritage.

Name: Tapkeshwar Mahadev Temple
Description: Tapkeshwar Mahadev Temple, nestled in the forests of Dehradun, is dedicated to Lord Shiva. The temple is built over a natural cave where water droplets continuously fall on the Shiva Linga, creating a serene ambiance. It is a popular pilgrimage site, especially during Shivratri.

Name: Mahasu Devta Temple
Description: Mahasu Devta Temple, located in Hanol village, is dedicated to Mahasu Devta, a regional deity revered in the Jaunsar-Bawar region. Built in the 9th century, the temple showcases traditional Kath-Kuni architecture and holds significant cultural importance.

Name: Kunjapuri Devi Temple
Description: Kunjapuri Devi Temple, situated at an altitude of 1,676 meters near Rishikesh, is one of the 52 Shakti Peethas. The temple offers panoramic views of the Himalayan peaks and the Ganges River, making it a popular spot for both pilgrims and tourists.

Name: Triyuginarayan Temple
Description: Triyuginarayan Temple, located in the Rudraprayag district, is believed to be the sacred site where Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati were married. The temple features an eternal flame that is said to have been burning since their divine union.

Name: Tungnath Temple
Description: Tungnath Temple, perched at an elevation of 3,680 meters in the Rudraprayag district, is the highest Shiva temple in the world. It is one of the Panch Kedar temples and is believed to be over 1,000 years old.

Name: Jageshwar Dham
Description: Jageshwar Dham, located near Almora, is a cluster of over 100 ancient stone temples dedicated to Lord Shiva. Dating between the 7th and 14th centuries, the site is a significant archaeological and religious site in Uttarakhand.

Name: Baijnath Temple
Description: Baijnath Temple, situated on the banks of the Gomati River in Bageshwar district, is a historic temple dedicated to Lord Shiva. Built in the 12th century by the Katyuri kings, the temple complex is known for its exquisite stone carvings and sculptures.
